content: I want to develop a cross-platform mobile tool in C++, and I think wamr can help me do this, but I don't know how to do it. Is there any relevant documentation on this?

Hi, have you taken a look at the WARM repo?

I see this folder there:
https://github.com/bytecodealliance/wasm-micro-runtime/tree/b0c6d5c23a243cb51f2672f552882de24305f42b/product-mini/platforms/ios

Also, there's a #wamr channel, which might be a good place to inquire further!

wasm-micro-runtime/product-mini/platforms/ios at b0c6d5c23a243cb51f2672f552882de24305f42b · bytecodealliance/wasm-micro-runtime
WebAssembly Micro Runtime (WAMR). Contribute to bytecodealliance/wasm-micro-runtime development by creating an account on GitHub.
